xwikidoc.title: IRC Archive for channel #ccm on 19 April 2013
xwikidoc.content: <sdumitriu> Did you add the third measurement? 00:01 <kushalk124> Yup added the third measurement 00:01 <kushalk124> Do i need to add all values ? I added only weight 00:01 <kushalk124> The 2nd and 3rd measurement seems to be same 00:01 <kushalk124> but the first one 00:01 <kushalk124> in form 00:02 <kushalk124> there is a difference in fields display 00:07 <sdumitriu> No, don't bother with the values 00:07 <sdumitriu> You should see that the labels are smaller for the new measurement 00:13 <kushalk124> Form labels ? 00:13 <kushalk124> They seem to be of same size 00:14 <kushalk124> font-size : 14px 00:20 <sdumitriu> It's late, I have to go to sleep 00:20 <sdumitriu> We'll continue later 00:21 <kushalk124> Just one things can you just screenshot the bug on your computer 00:22 <kushalk124> i will try to reproduce it 00:22 <kushalk124> Sorry for keeping you awake 00:22 <sdumitriu> K 00:27 <kushalk124> Not able to download on irc 00:27 <sdumitriu> Uploaded on the issue page: https://github.com/compbio-UofT/phenotips/issues/389 00:27 <kushalk124> Ok 00:27 <kushalk124> Thank you for the help 00:27 <kushalk124> Will meet you tomorrow 00:31 <kushalk124> Ok was able to reproduce it 00:33 <kushalk124> I guess some issues with my install also , I dont see those images on the sides of labels 00:51 <AvneeNathani> has joined #ccm 00:53 <AvneeNathani> Hello 01:07 <kushalk124> Hey 01:11 <AvneeNathani> Hi @kushalk124 01:11 <AvneeNathani> I wanted to talk about a project that I'm interested in for GSoC 01:12 <kushalk124> Hey AvneeNathani , the mentors are not online at this moment they left an hour back 01:12 <kushalk124> I might be able to help 01:14 <AvneeNathani> thanks. kushalk124, are you a mentor too? 01:14 <kushalk124> No 01:14 <AvneeNathani> oh 01:15 <AvneeNathani> you're also a student, like me? 01:15 <kushalk124> What timezone you are in ? Mentors are at timezone utc -4 so they would be able i guess after 6-7hrs or more 01:15 <kushalk124> Yup 01:15 <AvneeNathani> Ok, thanks kushal 01:16 <kushalk124> Np :) 01:16 <kushalk124> You had some query ? 01:17 <AvneeNathani> has left #ccm 02:12 <froggy> has joined #ccm 02:32 <Dhritiman> has joined #ccm 02:44 <UCC> has joined #ccm 03:02 <kushalk124> has joined #ccm 03:08 <kushalk124> has joined #ccm 03:15 <kushalkhandelwal> has joined #ccm 03:19 <kushalkhandelwal> has joined #ccm 03:26 <kushalkhandelwal> has joined #ccm 03:31 <kushalkhandelwal> has joined #ccm 03:35 <kushalkhandelwal> has joined #ccm 03:41 <kushalkhandelwal> has joined #ccm 03:45 <kushalkhandelwal> has joined #ccm 03:51 <kushalkhandelwal> has joined #ccm 03:56 <ravigarg27> has joined #ccm 03:58 <kushalkhandelwal> has joined #ccm 04:02 <kushalkhandelwal> has joined #ccm 04:06 <kushalkhandelwal> has joined #ccm 04:08 <UCC> has joined #ccm 04:12 <kushalkhandelwal> has joined #ccm 04:19 <kushalkhandelwal> has joined #ccm 04:32 <kushalkhandelwal> has joined #ccm 04:37 <mehitabel> has joined #ccm 04:39 <UCC> Hi 04:44 <UCC> I'm a second year CS student and I want to participate in gsoc 2013 04:45 <UCC> I looked over the proposed project ideas 04:45 <UCC> But I'm not sure on your requirement's knowledge-wise 04:53 <kushalkhandelwal> has joined #ccm 04:53 <UCC> I have basic experience with Android, web technologies - HTML,CSS,Javascript, python (I never built a site from scratch but as I learned I developed small components in oder to develop my skills, and I also am currently contributing to Mozilla Firefox, and have contributed in the past to WebKit with adding testing support for an experimental CSS3 module). I also had some experience with MySql and Django some time ago but I need some time to relearn. 04:55 <UCC> I was wondering what project would be suitable for my skills (consider that I have only basic knowledge, I've never did any large project by myself, except an Android game). And how should I start contributing in order to show you my abilities as a candidate for the project. 05:05 <kushalkhandelwal> has joined #ccm 05:07 <UCC> The project - mobile application for chronic disease management looks interesting. The problem is that I will only be able to develop for Android and for anything related to C/C++. And also, if possible I would like more details on the project, I wan't to make sure I grasp the full picture. 05:17 <UCC> Also, having a strong background in data structure and algorithms (I participated in and won many informatics contest) the project Visualization and analysis of patient data for the diagnosis of genetic disorders and also the project Mobile web interface for PhenoTips sound great and I'm confident I can do them, but I will require some help from the mentor in order to polish my web skills and learn all that is necessary, but I hope that won't be an impediment be 05:17 <UCC> cause I'm a fast learner, I love to learn new technologies and I could get up to speed quickly and start developing before the official coding period starts. 05:22 <ravigarg27> has joined #ccm 05:33 <kushalkhandelwal> has joined #ccm 05:37 <kushalkhandelwal> has joined #ccm 05:55 <kushalkhandelwal> has joined #ccm 06:06 <kushalkhandelwal> has joined #ccm 06:42 <kushalkhandelwal> has joined #ccm 06:51 <kushalkhandelwal> has joined #ccm 07:09 <sdumitriu> Good morning 07:11 <UCC> has joined #ccm 07:17 <UCC> has joined #ccm 07:18 <sdumitriu> Hey UCC 07:21 <unknown__> has joined #ccm 07:31 <UCC> has joined #ccm 08:20 <ravigarg27> has joined #ccm 09:32 <kushalkhandelwal> has joined #ccm 09:47 <mehitabel> has joined #ccm 09:53 <Krinye> has joined #ccm 10:03 <sdumitriu1> has joined #ccm 10:08 <kushalkhandelwal> has joined #ccm 10:08 <sdumitriu1> Hey kushalkhandelwal 10:08 <sdumitriu1> Any progress on that issue? 10:15 <UCC> Hi sdumitriu, have you read my questions ? 10:15 <sdumitriu1> Yes 10:17 <UCC> can you give me some advice ? 10:18 <sdumitriu1> Android apps are written in a subset of Java, so would you say you also know Java? 10:19 <sdumitriu1> Also, how well do you know web technologies? 10:20 <UCC> yes, I know java pretty well, and my main experience is in C/C++ . I forgot to mention that. 10:22 <UCC> Web technologies ... well ... I know most of what I should know about html/css/javascript (it's not much anyway). The problem is I never worked on a big project with this technologies. 10:23 <UCC> The main idea is ... i know the language, I just never used it that much. That's why I think this is the perfect moment to learn and improve 10:25 <UCC> From what I know from other collegues that have participated in past Gsoc's, the mentors didn't require knowledge of the language or certain technologies, they helped them learn in parallel. It's not necessary the case with me, I just wanted to point out that I'm not that used to web technologies. 10:25 <UCC> *necessarily 10:26 <sdumitriu1> Indeed 10:28 <sdumitriu1> So what would you prefer? 10:29 <sdumitriu1> A project is more successful if you really like it 10:32 <ravigarg27> has joined #ccm 10:34 <UCC> That what I was thinking .... I should chose something I really like and stand to gain more knowledge and experience. I really like the idea of - Mobile application for chronic disease management. But I'm not sure exactly what I will do because, from what I see, C/C++ , web development and other technologies are required. So is the project Android related or it is related on multiple platforms. 10:35 <UCC> ? 10:35 <sdumitriu1> This project is very open ended 10:36 <sdumitriu1> Since it's a new project, it doesn't have any limits imposed 10:36 <sdumitriu1> It can be an Android app 10:36 <sdumitriu1> It can be an app + server that handles data from the client 10:42 <UCC> well that is cool, I like the ideea of using multiple technologies and learn more things. Maybe even create a web interface and also, as you said create client-server model to store and use information with a database. Sounds interesting. Should I contact the mentor mentioned in contacts and discuss with him further? 10:44 <sdumitriu1> Yes, but send email to ccm-mentors@cs.toronto.edu, not directly to Marc 10:47 <UCC> Well ... then I will send it to ccm-mentors@cs.toronto.edu, but to whom should it be adressed? to Marc ? or should I say the name of the project and ask for further guidance. 10:50 <sdumitriu1> Just ask for guidance 10:53 <UCC> ok, thank you :) 11:58 <ravigarg27> has joined #ccm 12:07 <kushalkhandelwal> has joined #ccm 12:19 <kushalkhandelwal> has joined #ccm 12:27 <kushalkhandelwal> has joined #ccm 12:32 <kushalkhandelwal> has joined #ccm 12:37 <kushalkhandelwal> has joined #ccm 12:42 <ravigarg27> has joined #ccm 13:12 <krinye> has joined #ccm 13:23 <ravigarg27_> has joined #ccm 13:39 <camelia_> has joined #ccm 14:03 <krinye> has joined #ccm 14:04 <krinye> hello guys 14:04 <sdumitriu1> Hi 14:05 <krinye> Hi sdumitriu! I decided to focus on the Expansion of the Safe Heart App 14:06 <krinye> Is it possible to view the database schema? It would be interesting to see what data the app collects. 14:08 <sdumitriu1> Hm, that's Marc's project, and unfortunately he's off today 14:08 <sdumitriu1> You should send him an email 14:09 <krinye> I have already emailed him. I will wait until Tuesday for the reply and then follow up 14:15 <vshivam> has joined #ccm 14:19 <vshivam> has joined #ccm 14:26 <AvneeNathani> has joined #ccm 14:30 <AvneeNathani> Hi @marta 14:50 <vshivam> has joined #ccm 14:51 <krinye> has joined #ccm 14:54 <vshivam> has joined #ccm 14:58 <vshivam> has joined #ccm 15:02 <vshivam> has joined #ccm 15:07 <vshivam> has joined #ccm 15:09 <kushalkhandelwal> has joined #ccm 15:09 <kushalkhandelwal> Hi sdumitriu 15:09 <kushalkhandelwal> Sorry could not reply to you at that time. Lots of end semester submissions and viva took the entire day 15:11 <kushalkhandelwal> sdumitriu1, there ? 15:11 <kushalkhandelwal> I was going through xwiki documentation to have a gist of the markup they use 15:12 <sdumitriu1> kushalkhandelwal: Back 15:14 <kushalkhandelwal> has joined #ccm 15:14 <kushalkhandelwal> Network :\ 15:16 <sdumitriu1> I know 15:17 <camelia_> has joined #ccm 15:18 <vshivam> has joined #ccm 15:22 <vshivam> has joined #ccm 15:28 <vshivam> has joined #ccm 15:37 <vshivam> has joined #ccm 15:40 <vshivam> has joined #ccm 15:42 <kushalkhandelwal> It is also using Velocity scripting ? 15:42 <kushalkhandelwal> sdumitriu1: 15:42 <sdumitriu1> Yes 15:44 <kushalkhandelwal> Ok 15:44 <vshivam> has joined #ccm 15:53 <kushalkhandelwal> sdumitriu1: Why I am getting this error "Failed to execute the [velocity] macro" on my page 15:54 <kushalkhandelwal> Some build errors ? 15:54 <kushalkhandelwal> that unable to find pom for velocity or something 15:55 <kushalkhandelwal> I think while builiding I had some warning 15:55 <kushalkhandelwal> Also this Importing XAR file: /home/kushal/Projects/phenotips/resources/ui/target/phenotips-ui.xar 2013-04-19 10:38:00,281 [main] ERROR o.x.e.i.StandardEnvironment - Configured temporary directory [/tmp/xwiki-temp] is not writable. 2013-04-19 10:38:00,286 [main] WARN c.x.x.p.p.Package - Failed to parse document [PhenoTips/WebHome.xml] from XML during import, thus it will not be installed. The error was: Cou 15:56 <sdumitriu1> Hm, these errors shouldn't happen 15:56 <kushalkhandelwal> Are there no build tests for these ? 15:57 <sdumitriu1> The build should have failed if a document fails to import 15:59 <kushalkhandelwal> I got a build success ? 15:59 <kushalkhandelwal> [INFO] Reactor Summary: [INFO] [INFO] PhenoTips - Parent POM ............................ SUCCESS [7.911s] [INFO] PhenoTips - Various Java components ............... SUCCESS [0.757s] [INFO] PhenoTips - OBO to Solr conversion ................ SUCCESS [3.269s] [INFO] PhenoTips - Solr Access Service ................... SUCCESS [3.302s] [INFO] PhenoTips - Listeners for updating computed Patient fields SUCCESS [11.394s] [INFO] P 15:59 <kushalkhandelwal> Is the test coverage complete ? 16:00 <sdumitriu1> Nope, unfortunately the UI part doesn't have any tests yet, since it was developed as a prototype initially, nobody expected it to have this much success 16:01 <sdumitriu1> That's another thing we have to do... 16:01 <kushalkhandelwal> I can write tests 16:01 <kushalkhandelwal> I was thinking of proposing that 16:02 <sdumitriu1> Are you familiar with Selenium? 16:02 <kushalkhandelwal> And also integrating CI on github 16:02 <sdumitriu1> We have CI 16:02 <sdumitriu1> ci.cs.toronto.edu 16:02 <kushalkhandelwal> Yesterday you asked me not to edit pom.xml directly , why is that so ? 16:02 <sdumitriu1> XWiki has a fairly good test framework, so it's easy to write UI tests 16:02 <sdumitriu1> No, not pom.xml, but the other XML files 16:03 <sdumitriu1> Because it's much easier to develop live in the wiki 16:03 <sdumitriu1> You just save and view the results instantly 16:03 <kushalkhandelwal> Jenkins :D 16:03 <kushalkhandelwal> That is there 16:03 <kushalkhandelwal> True 16:03 <sdumitriu1> Whereas writing on the filesystem means you have to build and run after each change 16:03 <sdumitriu1> It's a much slower dev process 16:04 <sdumitriu1> In the wiki it takes a second to save and reload the page, and see if it works or still needs improvements 16:04 <kushalkhandelwal> for the final changes we write in the filesystem , actually I thot there should have been a CI so that every time someone commits a change 16:04 <sdumitriu1> And when you're done, you can export the document and commit it 16:04 <kushalkhandelwal> and push it before the pull we could have a build check 16:04 <kushalkhandelwal> We could integrate travis 16:05 <kushalkhandelwal> I was thinking on that line 16:05 <kushalkhandelwal> I agree developing live is a faster dev practice 16:05 <kushalkhandelwal> java tests written in Junit ? 16:06 <sdumitriu1> For the Java code, JUnit + JMock 16:07 <sdumitriu1> You can see tests in components/patient-measurements/patient-measurements-api 16:07 <sdumitriu1> Travis is a good idea 16:07 <sdumitriu1> So far we're checking the build post-factum 16:07 <sdumitriu1> If it fails, we get an email and then we have to fix it 16:07 <sdumitriu1> The infra is new as well 16:08 <kushalkhandelwal> All night yesterday I was thinking why we dont have a CI 16:08 <sdumitriu1> You can see that Jenkins only had time to build 57 times so far 16:08 <kushalkhandelwal> Okay 16:08 <kushalkhandelwal> so we can integrate travis 16:08 <sdumitriu1> Did you look at http://phenotips.org/Community/ ? 16:08 <sdumitriu1> It links to http://phenotips.org/Community/ContinuousBuild 16:09 <kushalkhandelwal> we can have a stable branch 16:09 <kushalkhandelwal> and other feature branches 16:09 <sdumitriu1> Yep, that's my ideal way of working 16:09 <kushalkhandelwal> I had checked the page though 16:09 <kushalkhandelwal> I missed that out :P 16:10 <sdumitriu1> But so far, after the early prototyping stage, features have been kind of small 16:10 <kushalkhandelwal> Hm 16:11 <kushalkhandelwal> So my task list : 1) Form Builder 2) Integrate Travis 3) Increase test coverage 4) Improve Documentation on the Github Repo 16:12 <kushalkhandelwal> Can we hook jenkins to Github ? 16:12 <kushalkhandelwal> https://wiki.jenkins-ci.org/display/JENKINS/GitHub+Plugin 16:12 <sdumitriu1> It is 16:12 <sdumitriu1> A push triggers a build 16:12 <kushalkhandelwal> So that we have a build notification 16:12 <sdumitriu1> A build failure sends emails 16:12 <kushalkhandelwal> Displayed on the github repo 16:12 <kushalkhandelwal> Hm 16:13 <sdumitriu1> http://mail.phenotips.org/pipermail/notifications/Week-of-Mon-20130408/subject.html 16:17 <kushalkhandelwal> Hm 16:18 <sdumitriu1> WDYM by 1) Form Builder? 16:19 <kushalkhandelwal> Form Builder for phenotips 16:20 <kushalkhandelwal> I was going through the idea while I was building phenotips 16:20 <sdumitriu1> But I thought you're applying for the ontologies integration project 16:20 <kushalkhandelwal> Yes I am 16:20 <kushalkhandelwal> I was also going through the idea 16:20 <sdumitriu1> OK 16:21 <kushalkhandelwal> Also Marta pointed me that I should try for Form Builder as I dont have Java knowledge 16:21 <sdumitriu1> Right 16:21 <kushalkhandelwal> What do you say . What should I go for ? 16:21 <sdumitriu1> Form builder 16:21 <kushalkhandelwal> One thing for sure , I liked working 16:21 <kushalkhandelwal> Learnt a lot about Maven , Solr 16:22 <sdumitriu1> I have a question for you 16:22 <kushalkhandelwal> and now learning apache velocity and Xwiki 16:22 <kushalkhandelwal> yes 16:22 <sdumitriu1> Indian names are always in the form <Given name> <Family name>, like in English? 16:22 <kushalkhandelwal> Not always 16:22 <kushalkhandelwal> Regios specific 16:23 <kushalkhandelwal> *region 16:23 <kushalkhandelwal> Also some government ids mention as <Family Name> <Give Name> 16:23 <kushalkhandelwal> In northern part of the country it is mostly <Given name> <Family name> 16:24 <kushalkhandelwal> Whereas if you go towards the southern part of the country name can be as big as 10 words 16:24 <kushalkhandelwal> Name has all the family history info 16:24 <sdumitriu1> Yeah, I've had a lot of students from Sri Lanka, and they usually have at least 4 names 16:26 <kushalkhandelwal> Hm 16:26 <sdumitriu1> But I guess most of the good IT universities are in the north 16:26 <kushalkhandelwal> Spread across the country 16:26 <sdumitriu1> Indeed 16:26 <kushalkhandelwal> Some of the best IITs in north and central regions 16:27 <kushalkhandelwal> I am from BITS Pilani University 16:27 <kushalkhandelwal> Which has 3 Campuses in India 16:27 <kushalkhandelwal> Apart from that , IIT Madras is in south 16:27 <kushalkhandelwal> One of the finest Engineering College 16:27 <kushalkhandelwal> and IIIT Hyderabad also in south 16:27 <sdumitriu1> I'm looking at the map now and I've seen students from Chennai, and if I remember correctly, even from Madurai 16:28 <kushalkhandelwal> Last 2 are the best in Computer Science 16:28 <kushalkhandelwal> and IISc Bangalore 16:28 <kushalkhandelwal> :) 16:28 <kushalkhandelwal> Madras is old name for Chennai 16:31 <kushalkhandelwal> Still in maps ? :P 16:31 <kushalkhandelwal> sdumitriu1: 16:31 <sdumitriu1> Yes 16:33 <sdumitriu1> OK, done 16:34 <kushalkhandelwal> What was the verdict ? 16:34 <sdumitriu1> Earth is beautiful 16:35 <kushalkhandelwal> Haha :D 16:39 <kushalkhandelwal> Ok so coming to the issue 16:39 <kushalkhandelwal> any idea why I was getting that error 16:45 <kushalkhandelwal> has joined #ccm 16:46 <kushalk124> has joined #ccm 16:46 <kushalkhandelwal> sdumitriu, 16:46 <kushalkhandelwal> sdumitriu1, 16:46 <kushalkhandelwal> Error ? 16:49 <sdumitriu1> Sorry, somebody else needed me 16:49 <sdumitriu1> Can you pastebin the full error? 16:50 <kushalk124> Should i build it again ? Then only I will see the error completely 16:52 <kushalk124> http://pastebin.com/TCtKgWBz 17:00 <sdumitriu1> The main problem is: 17:00 <sdumitriu1> Configured temporary directory [/tmp/xwiki-temp] is not writable 17:01 <sdumitriu1> One easy way of fixing this is: 17:01 <sdumitriu1> sudo mkdir /tmp/xwiki-temp 17:02 <sdumitriu1> sudo chown kushal /tmp/xwiki-temp 17:02 <sdumitriu1> Then try again 17:02 <sdumitriu1> What distro are you using? 17:02 <kushalk124> yes did that already 17:03 <kushalk124> Ubunutu 12.04 17:03 <kushalk124> i should do mvn clean install 17:03 <sdumitriu1> Yes 17:05 <kushalk124> I think we should document some of the common errors that might occur 17:06 <sdumitriu1> Yep 17:06 <sdumitriu1> Hm, I think I know 17:07 <sdumitriu1> That might have been created for root when you did the sudo mvn install 17:07 <kushalk124> Oh 17:10 <sdumitriu1> So maybe you need to do 17:10 <sdumitriu1> sudo chown -R kushal /tmp/xwiki-temp 17:10 <kushalk124> Yep did that and started the build 17:15 <kushalk124> One question 17:15 <kushalk124> Till the time it builds 17:15 <sdumitriu1> Shoot 17:16 <kushalk124> Build fi nished 17:16 <kushalk124> Warning : [WARNING] Cannot include project artifact: edu.toronto.cs.phenotips:phenotips-standalone:pom:1.0-SNAPSHOT; it doesn't have an associated file or directory. 17:17 <kushalk124> [INFO] ... Importing XAR file: /home/kushal/Projects/GSOC/phenotips/resources/ui/target/phenotips-ui.xar 2013-04-20 02:41:40,428 [main] WARN iComponentManagerEventListener - Failed to create wiki component(s) for document [Main.UserDirectory]: Registering UI extensions requires admin rights 17:17 <kushalk124> question after this 17:18 <sdumitriu1> Ignore those 17:19 <kushalk124> The second one also ? 17:19 <kushalk124> Its not able to create the components 17:19 <sdumitriu1> It's normal 17:19 <kushalk124> I dont see those images next to labels in the form 17:20 <kushalk124> Ok 17:20 <sdumitriu1> Registering UI extensions requires admin rights" is OK, since at this stage we're just putting documents in a database, the "extension registration" doesn't matter 17:20 <sdumitriu1> FYI, this is caused by the fact that during the database import, documents are imported in a random order, meaning that the rights can be imported after the documents that need those rights 17:20 <sdumitriu1> No images again? 17:20 <sdumitriu1> Try to force a cache refresh 17:20 <kushalk124> Yep 17:21 <kushalk124> Oh 17:26 <kushalk124> :) 17:26 <kushalk124> works 17:32 <kushalk124> Question 17:37 <sdumitriu1> Still waiting 17:40 <kushalk124> you in University of Toronto ? 17:40 <kushalk124> Working as ? 17:43 <kushalk124> Is there a way of getting the orignal code of PatientSheetCode without rebuilding , i made some change but need the orignal code again sdumitriu1 17:43 <sdumitriu1> Yes, UofT at the moment, working as a software developer 17:44 <kushalk124> And you are part of Xwiki also ? You not me ntoring over there ? 17:44 <sdumitriu1> Yes, long time committer for XWiki, mentor, and organization administrator 17:45 <kushalk124> Okay you are organization administrator I didnt knew that 17:45 <kushalk124> Liked some of the ideas there 17:45 <kushalk124> Never used xwiki before 17:45 <kushalk124> but when i started reading about it today loved it 17:45 <sdumitriu1> Yep, that's the problem with it, too few people know about XWiki 17:46 <kushalk124> Applying for different Gsoc organizations is itself a good learning experience 17:46 <sdumitriu1> Yes 17:46 <kushalk124> Can you give me the orignal patientsheetcode 17:47 <kushalk124> Line 159 change <label class="hint" > to <label class="" > 17:47 <kushalk124> that should fix the bug 17:48 <sdumitriu1> Hehe, you found it 17:48 <kushalk124> Long time back 15-20 mins 17:48 <kushalk124> actually i was reading the code 17:48 <kushalk124> i though by mistake i delted some things else also 17:48 <kushalk124> :P 17:48 <sdumitriu1> Hm, the problem with it is that the XML file is encoded 17:49 <kushalk124> You added this bug ? 17:49 <sdumitriu1> So & < and > are & < > 17:49 <sdumitriu1> WDYM added? 17:49 <kushalk124> Was it there before ? Or you left it as an easyfix 17:49 <sdumitriu1> At some point the class="hint" was in two places 17:50 <kushalk124> yes 17:50 <sdumitriu1> One was removed when users told us that the font is too small and can't be easily read 17:50 <kushalk124> Ohh 17:50 <sdumitriu1> So marta removed one of the instances, but forgot about the second one 17:50 <sdumitriu1> And we noticed the bug a few days ago, but decided to leave it in for a while as an easy fix 17:51 <sdumitriu1> For students 17:51 <sdumitriu1> To fix it it would be simpler to just edit the XML file on the filesystem 17:51 <kushalk124> Fixing a minor bug was fun , i got introduced to Xwiki and velocity :D 17:51 <sdumitriu1> I said you shouldn't do that, but for such a small change it's OK 17:51 <kushalk124> So should i remove it from the xml 17:52 <kushalk124> For the final commit now we can remove it 17:54 <sdumitriu1> Yes 17:54 <sdumitriu1> Do you know how to make a pull request? I'll await your response on that :) 20:33 <AvneeNathani> thanks marta.. 20:33 <marta_> do you have anything specific you wish to ask about? or just details in general? 20:34 <AvneeNathani> well.. as mentioned in my email.. ,I wanted to know if you had any ideas for the Web UI that you wish to build 20:34 <AvneeNathani> do you have a design already? 20:35 <marta_> not a very well defined one, this is still in progress 20:36 <AvneeNathani> ah ok... 20:36 <marta_> one thing to note is that our users are more interested in having this work nicely on tablets, and less interested in phones 20:37 <marta_> so, with a not so tiny screen, we have some more freedom 20:38 <AvneeNathani> right... that's true. Tablets have more real estate for this 20:38 <AvneeNathani> are there any specific resolutions that you are looking to target? even for tablets? 20:41 <marta_> the most common screen size i've seen in our target group is the 10'' 20:42 <marta_> i don't remember any minis 20:42 <AvneeNathani> 10 inch screens.. that's great.. 20:44 <marta_> I guess the most important part is the user interaction 20:44 <marta_> right now it's a pain to click on tiny buttons on the touch screen 20:45 <marta_> also, when doing a search, the keyboard doesn't quite leave enough space to see all the results properly 20:46 <AvneeNathani> I see.. From what I saw in the demo page.. it had everything on one page - like for example, the form to add new patients is a long page with all those sections.. 20:46 <marta_> yes 20:46 <AvneeNathani> For the search, yes the keypad would take almost half the screen.. Need to see how we can enable a smart search 20:47 <AvneeNathani> May be the right thing here is to build the interface with the unnecessary stuff hidden but accessible (hidden in a different way) 20:47 <marta_> indeed 20:48 <AvneeNathani> For example, in the new form to add patients... unlike the desktop web interface, we may have tabs for different sections 20:48 <AvneeNathani> there are many different paradigms for screen switching on mobile / tablets.. may be we can leverage those 20:50 <marta_> one thing to know is that our users really like to have the selection form (the long list on the left), the summary box (which is right next to it) and the diagnosis section (the one underneath those two) all close together on the same screen :) 20:50 <marta_> oh, and the search box as well 20:50 <marta_> i know it sounds impossible and we need to compromise 20:51 <marta_> but we need to keep in mind that they have to be _very_ easily accessible 20:51 <marta_> because they are all correlated and updated with every change made by the user 20:52 <AvneeNathani> yes, the anchors on the right (like a Table of contents) are useful for navigation specially if we take a long page approach... 20:55 <AvneeNathani> May be a right way to start this project... would be by designing few mockups of the layout... for the interface 20:57 <AvneeNathani> once we have a design mockup acceptable... we can code it 21:00 <AvneeNathani> does that sound like a decent approach marta_? 21:01 <marta_> I think that, before the mockup, we should identify what works and what doesn't with the current UI (for desktop) when accessed from a tablet 21:02 <marta_> figure out what are the most frustrating parts 21:03 <marta_> this will help focus on what's important when doing the mockup 21:03 <marta_> we need to know exactly what are the problems that we are trying to solve 21:04 <AvneeNathani> yes, I agree.. we need to first evaluate the current design for the tablet... 21:05 <AvneeNathani> right.. so first step: test the current UI on a tablet... to identify what are the most frustrating parts.. and define the problem 21:06 <marta_> precisely :) 21:07 <AvneeNathani> great.. I'll include this and allot time for this in my proposal 21:07 <marta_> i have a list of problems already (identified by us -- the devs -- together with our users, but a fresh look wouldn't hurt 21:07 <marta_> we can compare lists after you have done your research :) 21:08 <AvneeNathani> yes! 21:08 <AvneeNathani> How many users do you have for the desktop web interface, if I may ask? 21:09 <AvneeNathani> just curious 21:12 <marta_> we have this installed at a couple of hospitals, and we host 4 more instances on ccm servers for research projects; we have quite a lot of registered users, but I know that many of them are not active 21:12 <marta_> i don't know if you're aware of this, but it turns out that doctors don;t really like computers :) 21:12 <AvneeNathani> I can understand.. 21:13 <vshivam> has joined #ccm 21:13 <marta_> that't why we have to work hard to make the software easy to use 21:14 <AvneeNathani> so true :) 21:18 <AvneeNathani> thanks marta for all the details..
